text: [CLUE] This character had an ultimate storage capacity of eight hundred quadrillion bits and a total linear computational speed of sixty trillion operations per second
This character had a romantic relationship with Kyle Riker and later recalled that she would have married him "in a cold minute", but quickly realized that his priorities were elsewhere
This Federation Flag Officer entered into an alliance with the Son'a, to covertly relocate the Ba'ku from their home in order to collect metaphasic particles from their planet's rings
This character was a young scientist who lived in Los Angeles during the late 20th century and sought extraterrestrials under Earth's SETI program with grant funding from entrepreneur Henry Starling
This character was considered a failure as a businessman but a mechanical and engineering genius who worked in a bar until becoming an engineer in the Bajoran Militia

This ambassador was diagnosed with Bendii Syndrome en route to a Legaran Conference, where he was to serve as negotiator. As his emotional control became weak, Captain Picard assisted in stabilizing his condition

This character took command of the Enterprise and posed as Captain, as a ruse to negotiate with Sybok for the hostages that he'd taken on Nimbus III, while a security team landed covertely on the planet

This flag officer defected to the Federation upon becoming convinced that his people were planning a war with the Federation, but later found that he'd been leaked false information by his own officers in order to test his loyalty
This character was supported by Worf in his bid for the Chancellery, with the promise that his family's name would be cleared of its dishonor. Worf ultimately killed this character many years later

This character credited the family tale of her ancestor, Shannon O'Donnel, for inspiring her to join Starfleet, for her alleged driving force in ensuring the construction of the Millennium Gate, despite strong local opposition

This character commanded the Starfleet vessel that responded to a distress call from the Klingon outpost at Narendra III in 2344, which was under attack the Romulans, before being pulled into a temporal rift
After graduation from Starfleet Academy, this character's first posting was conn officer on-board the USS Pegasus, where his youthful appearance earned him the nickname "Ensign Babyface"

This character was killed during the First Battle of Chin'toka on-board Deep Space 9, by a villain who was intent on releasing a Pah-wraith into a sacred Orb in order to imprison the Prophets in the wormhole

This character operated a Creole Kitchen in the French Quarter of New Orleans, serving specialties including blackened redfish, shrimp creole, shrimp remoulade, crawfish étouffée, jambalaya, pasta boudin, and gumbo

This retired character's Starfleet commission was re-activated by Fleet Admiral Nogura, using a little-known, seldom-used, reserve activation clause, at the request of Admiral James T. Kirk, during the V'ger incident of the mid 2270's

This character was believed to have been lost in a hull breach in the deflector control room of the Enterprise-B, caused by an energy tendril from the Nexus anomaly, but was later found to have survived
This character was a self-described "Aberdeen pub-crawler", who became known as the original miracle worker for his impressive work on-board the USS Enterprise

This ambassador drew the ire of Captain Archer, who felt that humans were being intentionally held back from advancement by this character's race.  This character had a close bond with Starfleet's Admiral Forrest, who gave his life to save him

This Enterprise medical technician quickly found himself the target of a witch hunt, organized by Vice Admiral Sate, as a result of his Romulan heritage that he'd intentionally concealed upon his application to Starfleet

This spiritual character was born under Cardassian rule, during the Bajoran occupation.  Although a revered figure among her people, she secretly collaborated with the Cardassians to reveal the location of a resistance cell in order to save 1,200 other Bajorans

This character avoided military service during his people's war with the Haakonians, who ultimately destroyed his planet's moon by using a weapon called the metreon cascade.  The next day, this character's world surrendered to the Haakonian forces unconditionally

This alien Captain transported himself and Captain Picard to the surface of a planet on which a dangerous electromagnetic lifeform resided, in hopes of establishing communication and relations between their respective people

This character's husband wanted their son raised in the Vulcan way, with displays of emotion discouraged.  This character later admitted to having given the family's adopted daughter all of the emotional love and support she had not been permitted to give her son
This character, who had overseen the assimilation of countless millions of individuals, had always sought a personal relationship with Captain Picard
This once renegade character's people taught him that a person does not own land or anything but the courage and loyalty in their hearts, which is where true power was said to come from
This character became a valuable member of the Voyager crew, serving as field medic under the tutelage of the EMH, and member in charge of the airponics bay
This Commander attempted to express a sexual interest in Praetor Shinzon, but was soundly rebuffed by him due to his loathing of all Romulans

Although this character was outwardly identical to his two brothers, he was not equipped with a positronic brain as sophisticated as those of his siblings and consequently had difficulty understanding simple concepts and processing information
This character was just five years old when he received a device that allowed him to see for the first time in his life. At age eight, he was brought his first pet, a Circassian cat

This villain was the product of Captain Picard's alternate timeline decision to allow Tasha Yar to return to the past with the Enterprise-B, where she was ultimately captured by the Romulans and forced to become the consort of a Romulan general
This character constructed a warp ship with Zefram Cochrane, and later befriended Captain Picard during the Enterprise's effort to prevent the Borg from altering the timeline
This character was one of a hundred newly formed of his kind to be sent out into the galaxy to gather information and explore the universe before returning to his people

This character, who later begrudgingly befriended Geordie, was a scientist who was considered a leader in warp field theory and its applications, making major contributions to the development of the Galaxy-class' warp drive system

This character who took a liking to Captain Picard was over 300 years old and one of the leading members of the Ba'ku, who left her star system after advancements in technology threatened to create weapons that would destroy all life on her world
This character attempted to bribe his way into the academy and ultimately became the first of his kind to be accepted to Starfleet
This character was a Chancellor of the High Council before being assassinated for his desire to pursue peaceful relations with the Federation

This character began work on Project Genesis with his mother, stationed on Regula I. As research progressed, traces of his father emerged in this character, including impatience for results and an eagerness for quick solutions

This character was created out of a transport accident that merged two individuals into one.  He made an impassioned plea to the crew of his ship to be spared, when a way to reverse the merging was found
This nervous and occasionally socially awkward character was excited to accept Michael Burnham as a roommate aboard the USS Discovery
The musical recordings of this holographic character, brought Starfleet troops some calm before the Siege of AR-558

This leader of his people was an aficionado of Hupyrian beetle snuff and pioneered several business ventures into the Gamma quadrant. He also became known for his liberal attitude towards the end of his reign
This mysterious character, reported to be from Tau Alpha C, sought to develop Wesley's special abilities and encouraged Captain Picard to do the same
This character was born to a Starfleet officer and a Betazoid ambassador, enjoying an empathic ability that assisted the Enterprise crew during their journeys
This character's Starfleet career was turned sour by a scandal at the Academy that saw one of his fellow squadron mates killed in a piloting accident
